title: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer admits Man Utd are seeking answers for dismal away form
text:

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer admits Manchester United are seeking answers for their dismal away form as they prepare to face Partizan Belgrade in the Europa League.

United are in Serbia hoping to arrest a run of 11 successive winless matches on the road - stretching back to their turnaround victory over Paris-Saint Germain in the Champions League at the Parc-des-Princes in March.

That win effectively secured Solskjaer the United job on a permanent basis after the former Red Devils striker led the team to nine straight wins after taking charge as interim manager.

Since then, United's form has nosedived alarmingly, with United failing to qualify for this season's Champions League and sitting just two points above the relegation zone in 14th place in the Premier League.

The pressure is also on in the Europa League after United drew 0-0 away to AZ Alkmaar in their last Group L game.

(Image: REUTERS)

United now face four away games on the bounce, with Thursday night's clash in Belgrade followed by trips to face Norwich, Chelsea and Bournemouth in the Premier league.

So Solskjaer needs to address United's away form fast - and asked how to do that, the Norwegian said he was still searching for the solution.

"It's a question we've asked ourselves as well," Solskjaer said. "Because after I came in we won nine on the bounce and since then we haven't won any.

"So, it's an issue we have to deal with, sort out as soon as possible. We've got four games away now on the trot, so hopefully those statistics will turn."

(Image: PA)

Solskjaer has done his homework on tonight's opponents Partizan - while he is already familiar with their winger Zoan Tosic, who he coached in United's reserves between 2009 and 2010.

"Of course, I've watched many (Partizan) games in the lead-up here," said Solskjaer.

"I also watched them when they played Molde, which is my old team. Of course it was a game that I was following very close.

"I know them, I spoke to the coach in Molde, what did he feel.

(Image: ANDREJ CUKIC/EPA-EFE/REX)

"Zoran I had in the reserves at Man United many times. A fantastic boy, great left foot, great work ethic.

"It'll be nice to meet Zoran tomorrow, but hopefully we stop his left foot because that is of the best quality.

"We've seen the team and prepared our team against them. A team with some pace, big strong striker and some talent in there. Two or three very exciting players."
description: United must start winning on the road as Europa League clash against Parizan Belgrade kicks off four away trips in a row
